page.title: 11THE NEWSAGENT'S
page.content: Smith's newsagents is one of the shop the children in class 5 like to go to. We interviewed the shopkeeper.Smith's the newsagents has had it's name for sixty_six years. The prices vary from a penny to thirteen pounds. The Sun newspaper sells the best from the papers. Sweets are about 24p a quarter. The thing that sells the best is sweets. the lady who we interviewed has been there for nine years she said there was eight people working there but about thirty including the paper boys. They sell boxes of chocolates and lighters for thirteen pounds. Here are some prices Daily newspapers;The Mirror ,The Herald and the Sun are 18p.The Daily Express,the Daily mail are 20p. The Daily Telegraph is 23p.Weekly magasines;The radio and T.V. times are 30p,Women's weekly is 28p.
